# Controls
You can change your keybinds at any time here:
## Movement To move, use [color=yellow][bold][keybind="MoveUp"][keybind="MoveLeft"][keybind="MoveDown"][keybind="MoveRight"][/bold][/color].
Slippery objects and surfaces will make you fall over for a couple of seconds. Hold [color=yellow][bold][keybind="Walk"][/bold][/color] to walk slowly enough to prevent slipping on most of them. You can switch walking to a [color=cyan]toggle[/color] in the controls menu.
You can [color=cyan]pull[/color] objects and mobile entities ([italic]mobs[/italic]). To start pulling, click [color=yellow][bold][keybind="TryPullObject"][/bold][/color] on a movable entity. While pulling, you can push the entity to your cursor with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="MovePulledObject"][/bold][/color]. Pull again or press [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ReleasePulledObject"][/bold][/color] to let go.
You may find yourself in a situation with [color=#EB2D3A][bold]low gravity[/bold][/color]. This will cause your character to drift around when moving. If you end up completely off-station in space, you'll need to [bold]throw objects[/bold] or [bold]spray a fire-extinguisher[/bold] to propel yourself.
## Interactions Standard, [color=yellow][bold][keybind="Use"][/bold][/color] interactions are context-sensitive and [bold]depend on the item in your active hand[/bold]. Some items have [bold]alternative interactions[/bold], such as locking lockers and ejecting sub-items from other items. To perform [color=cyan]alternative interactions[/color], use [color=yellow][bold][keybind="AltActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color].
Many items have use-in-hand interactions, such as opening a bottle, reloading a gun or switching to holding an axe with both hands. To activate or use a held item, click [color=yellow][bold][keybind="Use"][/bold][/color] on it, or press the [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ActivateItemInHand"][/bold][/color] hotkey if it's in the active hand. The alternative counterpart is [color=yellow][bold][keybind="AltActivateItemInHand"][/bold][/color].
You can interact with objects even when your hands are full. Perform [color=cyan]activation interactions[/color] by pressing [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color]. This allows you to interact with the world without picking items up and without using the items you're holding. [italic](Note: The alternative counterpart is still [color=yellow][bold][keybind="AltActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color].)[/italic]
To sum up, there are [bold]three[/bold] types of context-sensitive interactions. You can always click [color=yellow][bold][keybind="UIRightClick"/][/bold][/color] on an interactive entity to open the [color=cyan]context menu[/color]. This menu displays [bold][italic]standard[/italic][/bold], [bold]activation[/bold], [italic]alternative[/italic] (usually formatted like that), and other possible interactions in one list. Sometimes called the [italic]entity menu[/italic], it also helps you sort through large piles of items.
If you're ever unsure about an entity, you can [color=cyan]examine[/color] it by pressing [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ExamineEntity"][/bold][/color]. This opens a window displaying its name, a brief description, relevant details, and sometimes a link to the guidebook.
For more details about interactions, please refer to the [color=cyan]Wiki[/color].
## Hands Using [color=yellow][bold][keybind="Use"][/bold][/color] on holdable items in the world will pick them up and put them into your active hand. You can swap which hand is currently active with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="SwapHands"][/bold][/color].
To [color=cyan]drop[/color] an item from your active hand, use [color=yellow][bold][keybind="Drop"][/bold][/color] or alternatively [color=cyan]throw[/color] it to your cursor with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ThrowItemInHand"][/bold][/color].
## Drag-and-drop While most objects can be used by clicking on them, "using" mobs (mobile entities) requires a special type of interaction:
- Drag a mob onto a chair, a bed or objects like the medical scanner to place them onto it.
- Drag yourself onto a table to climb it (also doable with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="AltActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color]).
- Drag another player onto yourself to open the [bold]strip menu[/bold], allowing you to take their equipment.
## Inventory You can open you [color=cyan]inventory[/color] using [color=yellow][bold][keybind="OpenInventoryMenu"][/bold][/color]. Each slot on your HUD can be filled with an appropriate item.
Two of the slots on the hotbar correspond to your [bold]bag and belt[/bold]. You can open them using [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color] on them or by clicking the icon in the [bold]bottom right[/bold].
Pressing [color=yellow][bold][keybind="MoveStoredItem"][/bold][/color] will [color=cyan]take an item out[/color] of the bag. Holding it down will let you [color=cyan]drag[/color] the item to a different spot. While dragging, pressing [color=yellow][bold][keybind="RotateStoredItem"][/bold][/color] will [color=cyan]rotate[/color] the item.
You can still do all regular interactions with items in your bag, including [color=cyan]examining[/color] and opening the [color=cyan]context menu[/color].
To halve a stack, use [color=yellow][bold][keybind="AltActivateItemInWorld"][/bold][/color].
There are a few additional hotkeys worth knowing:
- [color=yellow][bold][keybind="OpenBackpack"][/bold][/color] and [color=yellow][bold][keybind="OpenBelt"][/bold][/color] toggle your bag and belt interfaces, respectively.
- [color=yellow][bold][keybind="SmartEquipBackpack"][/bold][/color] lets you swap items between your hands and the bag.
- [color=yellow][bold][keybind="SmartEquipBelt"][/bold][/color] does the same for your belt, making tool access faster.
## Camera The camera can [color=cyan]zoom[/color] in and out with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ZoomIn"][/bold][/color] and [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ZoomOut"][/bold][/color] and can be reset with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="ResetZoom"][/bold][/color]. Similarly, you can [color=cyan]rotate[/color] it left and right with [color=yellow][bold][keybind="CameraRotateLeft"][/bold][/color] and [color=yellow][bold][keybind="CameraRotateRight"][/bold][/color]. You can recenter it to the grid's rotation using [color=yellow][bold][keybind="CameraReset"][/bold][/color].
